page.title: 07C'BROOKE CASTLE DONKEY WELL
page.content: The medieval well in the courtyard replaced the well in the keep as the castle's water supply. It is 49.m.(161ft)deep and is fed by an underground stream. The first 7m is stone lined,the rest is cut into natural bedrock.It was dug by prisoners taking about three years to complete.The well house is an Elizabethan building and the tread-wheel,which is used to raise the bucket is also Elizebethan though much repared.Donkeys have been used for treading the wheel since the 18th.C. At the presant time there 4 donkeys, 3 jennies and 1 jack,only the jennies tread the wheel (for demonstration). The donkeys each work 2 hrs a day giving demonstrations to visitors treading the 5m diamitor tread-wheel to raise the bucket.The donkey has to walk 5.5m.to raise the bucket 1m.
